definitions.definition: The state or condition of having weight ; weight; heaviness .
The state or condition of being grave ; seriousness .
examples: I hope you appreciate the gravity of the situation.

definitions.definition: The phenomenon that, on earth, objects have weight ; the similar phenomenon on other celestial bodies such as the moon.
Gravitation , the universal force exercised by two bodies on each other by virtue of their masses .
A law or laws of gravitation : any theory which attempts to account for the phenomena of weight and/or the mutual attraction of massive objects ( Aristotelian gravity, Newtonian gravity).

main_definition: The state or condition of having weight ; weight; heaviness .
secondary_definitions: The state or condition of being grave ; seriousness .
( music ) The lowness of a note .
( physics ) The phenomenon that, on earth, objects have weight ; the similar phenomenon on other celestial bodies such as the moon.
( loosely , see usage notes ) Gravitation , the universal force exercised by two bodies on each other by virtue of their masses .
( physics ) A law or laws of gravitation : any theory which attempts to account for the phenomena of weight and/or the mutual attraction of massive objects ( Aristotelian gravity, Newtonian gravity).
